normalised: **Five G Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide 5G rollout continues at a rapid pace, with telecom operators Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio expanding their networks across Tier I, II, and III cities. As of 20/10/2024, Jio claims coverage in over 6,000 cities, while Airtel has reported significant progress in key metros like Mumbai, Delhi, and Kolkata.
normalised: New Delhi – The nationwide five G rollout continues at a rapid pace, with telecom operators Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio expanding their networks across Tier one, two, and three cities. As of twentieth october two thousand and twenty four, Jio claims coverage in over six thousand cities, while Airtel has reported significant progress in key metros like Mumbai, Delhi, and Kolkata.

unnormalised: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) recently held a review meeting at 11:00 hrs on 25/10/2024, urging operators to expedite infrastructure development in rural areas to bridge the digital divide. This includes the deployment of 5G-enabled services in areas with limited connectivity, bringing benefits to farmers and small businesses.
normalised: The Department of Telecommunications (D O T) recently held a review meeting at eleven hundred hours on twenty fifth october two thousand and twenty four, urging operators to expedite infrastructure development in rural areas to bridge the digital divide. This includes the deployment of five G-enabled services in areas with limited connectivity, bringing benefits to farmers and small businesses.

unnormalised: Analysts at ICICI Securities estimate that 5G subscriptions will surpass 500 million by 2026, driven by affordable data plans and increasing smartphone penetration. The estimated investment in 5G infrastructure by operators is projected to reach Rs. 3.5 lakh crore over the next three years, facilitating enhanced connectivity and fostering economic growth. The technology promises speeds 10x faster than 4G, enabling applications from telemedicine to smart city initiatives. Further updates are expected at 17:00 hrs on 01/11/2024.
normalised: Analysts at I C I C I Securities estimate that five G subscriptions will surpass five hundred million by two thousand and twenty six, driven by affordable data plans and increasing smartphone penetration. The estimated investment in five G infrastructure by operators is projected to reach rupee three point five lakh crore over the next three years, facilitating enhanced connectivity and fostering economic growth. The technology promises speeds ten times faster than four G, enabling applications from telemedicine to smart city initiatives. Further updates are expected at seventeen hundred hours on first november two thousand and twenty four.
